subject: AI & Agents
title: AI Literacy for Non-Technical Stakeholders
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on AI Literacy for Non-Technical Stakeholders.

hook.text: The CEO asks: 'Can we just make the AI 100% accurate by next sprint?'

buildup.text: Non-technical stakeholders need baseline AI literacy to set realistic expectations.

discovery.text: Key concepts to teach: probabilistic outputs, training data dependence, and iterative improvement.

twist.text: Overpromising AI capabilities to leadership creates disappointment and budget cuts later.

climax.text: Run monthly AI demos showing real performanceâ€”including failuresâ€”to build shared understanding.

punchline.text: Educated stakeholders make better AI decisions.

quiz.question: Why is AI literacy important for non-technical stakeholders?
options: To set realistic expectations about what AI can deliver
